target_text: "It is difficult to define and measure. That’s for sure. I think before agile, there was a great focus on product level quality. Mainly free of defects and meets customer’s needs. I saw in agile a shift toward code quality and a design that responds to change. There is also a continuous improvement of the process effort."

Codebook.Definition: Recognition that the concept being discussed is hard to define and quantify. Emphasizes uncertainty in establishing clear measures.
Focus on quality at the product level, characterized by being free of defects and meeting customer needs. Presented as the earlier emphasis before agile.
Shift toward prioritizing the quality of the code itself within agile contexts. Highlights attention to code-level attributes.
Priority on creating designs that can adapt to change. Frames adaptability as a key quality dimension.
Ongoing efforts to improve the development process. Suggests continual refinement rather than a one-time change.
